@graph.title: MEASURING STATIONS

@graph.title: Flow Measuring Foil
@graph.content: Foil that is wrapped around a pipe, to measure the flow velocity of the fluid inside. Foil is acting as sender as well as receiver for signals sent through pipe wall and fluid. The flow value is displayed by the foil as well.

hasCategory.categoryLabel: In which of the following areas can the idea be applied?
Who is using the idea?

textualRefinement.description: Describe your idea in more detail (e.g., how is it used?)
textualRefinement.content: Instead of showing the flow velocity (or volume flow or mass flow) in numbers it could show a defined color scale from low to high flows.

textualRefinement.description: Which problem does the idea solve?
textualRefinement.content:
Used as a measuring device. Quickly applicable and very universal.
When the foil is glowing in a certain color that is linked to a certain flow velocity under that foil section, it could indicate flow problems within a pipe grid. That would mean, that many foil are applied on many pipe sections.

covering table tennis tables to integrate new challenges for players - i.e. one has to hit moving circles on the table or you can show the score on the table. you could upgrade your existing table tennis set by applying it on the markings for example to show if your ball was in or out.

@graph.title: night glow
@graph.content: The TCO film concept can be used in situations in which a rudimentary glowing indication is needed at night, but at daytime should be transparent and not noticeable.

hasCategory.categoryLabel: In which of the following areas can the idea be applied?
Who is using the idea?

textualRefinement.description: Describe your idea in more detail (e.g., how is it used?)
textualRefinement.content:
Because of the simple circuit construction of glowing LEDs and a light sensor, it is very easy to produce TCO film sheets which can light up a word or a symbol at night. These films are transparent and could cover architecture or beautiful surfaces which need to be seen at daytime.
This tech could be used for advertising at night, safety indication in all public spaces and public transports, in domestic areas, offices, childcare products, the guidance systems etc.

textualRefinement.description: Which problem does the idea solve?
textualRefinement.content: glowing indication at night, invisible at daytime.

@graph.title: material stress
@graph.content: Transparent coating applied by spraying or as adhesive mat. The layer reacts on different impacts (mechanical micro-disruption, temperature, vibration, chemicals, ...) and indicates the affected area by changing from transparant to a highly visible color. Could be used for sensitive parts like wings of planes or important elements of a bridge.

When a pilot is surrounding the plane prior start for a visual check, that would help him tremendously to recognize problems.

textualRefinement.description: Describe your idea in more detail (e.g., how is it used?)

textualRefinement.description: Which problem does the idea solve?
textualRefinement.content: The uncertainty of whether food is still good, independent to the "best before" sign.

textualRefinement.description: Describe your idea in more detail (e.g., how is it used?)
textualRefinement.content: Scenario: person buys a yoghurt container and eats one spoon out of it. Then forgets about it. After a week, the person is not sure whether the yoghurt is still edible or not. When the package is using TCO-technology the package itself can indicate whether the food inside is still good. the whole package turns red and/or has a caution sign indicationg that the food has gone bad.
